resource.chars:
general is nothing but the independence 
and apparent individuality of the generative 
organ -
It cannot be too carefully borne in 
mind that zoological individuality is 
very different from metaphysical individuality 
and that the whole question of the propriety 
of the “Alternation theory” as a means of 
colligating the facts (for al but it can be 
nothing more) turns upon the nature 
and amount of this difference 
If the definition of the zoological 
individual be (as the writer believes it to 
be) ”the sum of the phenomena successively manifold 
by <s>or so are, whether <\s> and proceeding from,
a single ovum - whether these phenomena 
be invariably collocated in one point of space 
or distributed over many” then there 
is no essential difference between the 
reproductive processes in the higher & lower 
animals - and the Alternation theory 
becomes unnecessary
